docs.snippet: LEAD: The Coastal Corporation, a Houston-based energy company that owns the nation's third-largest natural gas pipeline, said today that it was seeking to acquire the Texas Eastern Corporation, a leading Northeastern supplier, in a cash tender off...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Coastal Corporation, a Houston-based energy company that owns the nation's third-largest natural gas pipeline, said today that it was seeking to acquire the Texas Eastern Corporation, a leading Northeastern supplier, in a cash tender offer worth $42 a share, or about $2.6 billion.

byline.original: By NINA ANDREWS, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: Chartreuse may have been the shade of the season last spring, but red is certainly this winter's bell ringer. Red hats, scarves, sweaters, suits, coats are seen scurrying about Manhattan....

headline.main: FASHION: By Design; Looking Ahead: Post-Red

docs.snippet: LEAD: As law enforcement officers go, the New York City Police have never had a reputation for being particularly conformist. And Nick Starkey, the shaggy, mustachioed protagonist of ''The January Man,'' an offbeat political melodrama that opened ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As law enforcement officers go, the New York City Police have never had a reputation for being particularly conformist. And Nick Starkey, the shaggy, mustachioed protagonist of ''The January Man,'' an offbeat political melodrama that opened Friday, is hardly your average Gotham police officer. Not by a long shot.

headline.main: 'The January Man' Dossier: The Force Is With It

docs.snippet: LEAD: The two ubiquitous artists of the late 1980's are Joseph Beuys and Andy Warhol. Beuys was featured in last year's inaugural exhibition of the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles and given prime place in the 1987 Documenta, whose theme ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The two ubiquitous artists of the late 1980's are Joseph Beuys and Andy Warhol. Beuys was featured in last year's inaugural exhibition of the Museum of Contemporary Art in Los Angeles and given prime place in the 1987 Documenta, whose theme was social and political art. Warhol had a museum and gallery show in New York City last fall.

headline.main: Beuys and Warhol Still Set the Tone - Even After Death

docs.snippet: LEAD: 'American' on Broadway Wouldn't it be nice if the year continued with news like this? And the news is that a show called ''An American in Paris'' (yes, it is the ''American in Paris'' you're thinking of) will, if everything goes as planned, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: 'American' on Broadway Wouldn't it be nice if the year continued with news like this? And the news is that a show called ''An American in Paris'' (yes, it is the ''American in Paris'' you're thinking of) will, if everything goes as planned, be on Broadway sometime next year.

docs.snippet: LEAD: ''The January Man'' is well titled. It's a big-budget mainstream production that, in spite of its first-rate writer, director and cast, manages to fail in just about every department. It couldn't have stood up to the competition from the sli...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''The January Man'' is well titled. It's a big-budget mainstream production that, in spite of its first-rate writer, director and cast, manages to fail in just about every department. It couldn't have stood up to the competition from the slightly less bad films released in December.

headline.main: Review/Film; Kevin Kline On the Trail Of a Killer
